ygData.subject: Re: EverQuest -- It is an RPG!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Where in any of this chain of messages have I stated anything which can be interpreted as a desire to get the most money or advance the quickest.  RPG s are
ygData.messageBody:
Where in any of this chain of messages have I stated anything which can
be interpreted as a desire to get the most money or advance the
quickest. RPG's are games which form some basis in reality and in
which you can play out a roll that may not exist in reality. Certain
conditions from the real world such as gravity, economy, etc. are
generally present from the real world in some form or another though
not always.

The current state of the game is all money must be derived from the
repetitious see Gnoll, kill Gnoll, loot Gnoll. There should certainly
be some opportunity to earn equal or less profit by plying a trade
skill if you so desire. I am obviously not suggesting the UO macro
skull caps with your tailor and buy a castle routine. It should be
simple to determine average money gained by characters adventuring and
use that information to set prices that NPC's will by trade goods at or
slightly below this level. Thus creating the opportunity for those who
wish to adventure to do so and make a living, those wishing to ply
trade skills to do so and make a living, and those wishing to do both
to be able as well.

For all the people who say if you are not having fun don't play. There
has to be two sides to have a discussion. If you cannot debate your
point with some meaning and elegance, don't subscribe to discussion
lists.

-----Original Message-----
From: duffjc
Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 10:36 AM
To: .EQ.Magic
Cc: duffjc
Subject: [_EQ_Magic] EverQuest -- It is an RPG!!!

From: duffjc@...

I don't want to get anyone mad at me but,
this is an RPG. ROLE PLAYING GAME!!!! The reason skills where put in
the game was to enhance the RPG experience. It isn't all supposed to
be, who can make the most money the fastest with the highest lvl.

Skills are not utterly pointless. They allow you to emerge yourself
into your character without the constant: You hit a gnoll for 14
damage.
for 10 hours a session. I know some skills cost more than you get out
of them, but think of it as a gaming dynamics. It is supposed to be
FUN guys. If your not having fun, don't play.

Sorry if I affended anyone, but I needed to vent an this situation. It
seems everyone has something bad to say.

Duff

Intrests in all things Arcane


Message: 4
Date: Mon, 10 May 1999 11:50:41 -0400
From: michael.andersen@...
Subject: Re: Malachite in Qeynos? NO MORE?!?!

Obviously never sell to NPC's what you can sell to other players. With
the exception of armor though there is minimal demand for items created
by the other skills.

When you finish pondering a trade and finally decide upon one you will
find how utterly pointless it is until you have invested about 200pp in
it (with the case of smithing or jewelry) or completely pointless
(brewing, pottery, etc.).
